Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Bo \Bo\, interj. [Cf. W. bw, an interj. of threatening or frightening; n., terror, fear, dread.] An exclamation used to startle or frighten. [Spelt also {boh} and {boo}.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: boo \boo\ v. to show displeasure (after a performance or speech) by making a prolonged sound of ``boo''. [WordNet 1.5]

boo n : a cry or noise made to express displeasure or contempt [syn: {hoot}, {Bronx cheer}, {hiss}, {raspberry}, {razzing}, {snort}, {bird}] v : show displeasure, as after a performance or speech [syn: {hiss}] [ant: {applaud}]
